results.name: Triangle read by rows giving successive states of cellular automaton generated by "Rule 182".
reference: S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science, Wolfram Media, 2002; Chapter 3.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9999, i.e., rows 0 - 99.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Elementary Cellular Automaton
S. Wolfram, Statistical mechanics of cellular automata, Rev. Mod. Phys., 55 (1983), 601--644.
S. Wolfram, A New Kind of Science
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
mathematica: Flatten@ Table[CellularAutomaton[182, {{1}, 0}, {{i}}], {i, 0, 9}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 02 2015, based on _N. J. A. Sloane_ at A071042 *)
xref: See A071042 for number of zeros at generation n.
